page.title: 17The Post Office, Bryanston
page.content: An interview with the Postmaster dealt with the problems of the shop. He is keen on the place of the small shop in the local village community, and is the Chairman of the Hampshire Association of Village Shopkeepers. He specialises to attract customers. Turnover is "adequate"; the opening of Safeways supermarket in Blandford in 1985 took some custom away. He took on the shop as a challenge, to try to compete with market giants. Proximity to the School brings its problems: shoplifting, noise, general annoyance. Pupils try to buy tobacco, which is legal if they are over l6 but against the school rules. In fact the most consistent month for takings is August, when the school is on holiday. Post Office work is unprofitable;its demands ensure the Postmaster's hobby, computing, is used to maximum benefit.
